questions.text: "My days are colored by a lasting hope; it's like I'm looking through a kaleidoscope."
questions.explanation:
"Brand New Life".

	"I see heaven everywhere I go, thank you for my brand new life." This song was written by Pete Kipley and Robert Ellis Orrall.

questions.text: "For the skies that you made blue, for the smiles the light reflected through."
questions.explanation:
"A Song for You".

	"If today was my very last day, and I lost my chance to say, in heaven I hope you would know, that you've been an angel for all you've done for me." Rachael co-wrote this song with Cindy Morgan.

questions.text: "I never understood how merciful love could be until I felt his flame light every part of me."
questions.explanation:
"No Greater Love".

	"No greater love than this, that you should lay down your life for someone such as me; I'd spend a lifetime wondering why. The beauty of heaven is here in my heart and I know there can be no greater love than this."

questions.text: "And every hurt he will finally redeem."
questions.explanation:
"Sanctuary.

	Rachael co-wrote this song with David Mullen, Andy Selby, and Melodie Joy.

questions.text: "There are days when there is no place that feels like home."
questions.explanation:
"Give Your Heart Away".

	"And you need to believe that you are not alone. Long ago Jesus came to show that His love lasts through all time." The beautifully orchestrated backround track was recorded by the London Session Orchestra.

questions.text: "Never bend, never sway, day after day."
questions.explanation:
"It's About You".

	"And just when I think that I've found you out, you open my eyes to what your love's about and I am forever changed." This song was written by Paige Lewis and Chris Roderiguez.

questions.text: "There is no question that my future's clear."
questions.explanation:
"Lead Me (I'll Follow)".

	Rachael co-wrote this song with Paige Lewis and Chris Roderiguez.

questions.text: "You could see something in me waiting to grow."
questions.explanation:
"Beautiful".

	"A little seed of what I could be how did you know? You saw my worth and called me forth with your sweet love." This song was written by David Mullen.

questions.text: "You were thirsty for love, you were so in need."
questions.explanation:
"Savior Song".

	This song was written by Nick Trevisick, Paige Lewis, and Matthew West.

questions.text: "Too many voices, too many noises, too many choices."
questions.explanation:
"I'm All Yours".

	Christian contemporary singers Natalie and Phillip Larue lend their talents to this recording as part of the backup vocals. Thanks for playing my quiz. If you have any comments or suggestions, I would love to hear from you.
